characters: IT DOESN'T MATTER WHAT YOUR NAME

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: cu: TV scrEEN ( DWAYNE ‘THE ROCK’ JOHNSON is battling another titan of pr wrestling in a WWE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH. The crowd chant in unison: “This is awesome! This is awesome!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG ZAK (14) is watching the match on an aging TV ina working class British home. He is transfixed, copying The Rock’s every move, as if rehearsing. KAISER, the FAMILY PUPPY yaps at his heels. PAN TO: YOUNG SARAYA (RAYA) (13) -- sitting on the sofa, ignoring the TV, texting on her flip-phone. On the TV, the crowd goes wild -- as The Rock is awarded WWE CHAMPIONSHIP BELT. Young Zak mimics The Rock’s victory celebration, holding IMAGINARY ‘BELT’ aloft. Raya glances at Zak -- at the TV -- yawns -- takes the remote, switches it over to the TV show ‘Charmed.’

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I’m watchin’ that!

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: It’s borin’.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: It’s homework. That'll be me one day. They WRESTLE over the remote. Raya extends her free arm w the remote out of reach. Zak grabs her arm -- pulls it behind her back -- twists h

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Owww! Zak! “ROWDY” RICKY KNIGHT enters -- 40s, MOHAWK, TATTOOS, BEE BELLY. He sees his son CHOKING his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Zak! What the fuck are you doin’?! Zak looks up.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’re gonna choke her, your arm should be here -- He adjusts Zak’s arm position -- Raya gags -- struggles i the choke hold.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yesss! Now she’s in trouble! JULIA “SWEET SARAYA” KNIGHT walks in -- 40s, PALE COMPLEX RAVEN BLACK HAIR STREAKED WITH BLOOD-RED HIGHLIGHTS. She her daughter being choked by her son, while her husband l on.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What the bloody hell’s goin’ on?!

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (gasping) He’s... choking... me!

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Then what you gonna do about it? Raya escapes Zak’s hold by spinning under his arm and twisting it at the shoulder joint.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Aggghhhh!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Can I just say, you don’t half look pretty today, Saraya. Don’t she look pretty, Jules?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: She's not just pretty on the outside, luv -- inside she’s got a heart of bloody gold. Raya releases her brother. Looks at her mum and dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you two wankers after?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: No, fuck off! TRACK with Raya as she strides from the living room and h upstairs -- Ricky, Julia and Zak following her.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Chantelle bailed on me, Princess. I’m a girl down for the ladies match.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Your brothers have taught you all the moves.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: No! I don’t wanna be a wrestler.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: You'll love the buzz, darlin’. It’s more addictive than... coke, crack and heroin combined.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Have you done coke, crack and heroin? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Not combined...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Princess, if I gotta do refunds I’m buggered six ways till Sunday. We need you to do this -- for the family. The word ‘family’ always hits home. Raya pauses at the to the stairs -- looks back down at her family.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I can’t wrestle some random girl. I'll screw it up. Julia looks at Ricky. Zak pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you weren't wrestlin’ a random girl...? Off Raya’s quizzical look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak -- now wearing a PINK WOMEN'S POWER RANGER outfit -- circles Raya in a TATTY WRESTLING RING beneath a home-mad banner that reads “WORLD ASSOCIATION OF WRESTLING (W.A.W. The TINY, HALF-EMPTY VENUE is a far cry from the WWE -- b the SMALL WORKING-CLASS CROWD buzz with anticipation. ANGLE ON: Julia and Ricky, watching expectantly from the of the room. The bell rings. Zak and Raya LOCK-UP.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (whispers ) I can’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: It’s like a dance. Just follow me.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna throw up.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Once they start cheerin’, you'll wanna do it forever... And with that he pulls away, bounces off the ropes -- dro Raya. The crowd CHEER. Raya gets up. Zak comes for her -- she ducks under his le bounces off the ropes -- CLOTHESLINES her brother to the The crowd may be tiny -- but they ROAR their approval. Raya stops momentarily, shocked -- looks at Zak, who smil at her. She smiles back. Ricky and Julia look on -- as the wave of adulation washe over Raya for the first time. Buoyed by the validation, Raya attacks her brother... the crowd CHEER... Julia and Ricky beam proudly. Brother and Sister lock up again -- Raya grinning now fr ear-to-ear. Zak smiles -- scoops up 13 YEAR OLD Raya -- BODY SLAMS he down -- -- and when she lands on her back -- she is SEVENTEEN YEA OLD. She nimbly leaps back up. It’s FOUR YEARS LATER (2009). Another SHABBY VENUE -- sam tatty ring, same home-made banner, now even rougher round edges. The crowd HECKLE AND CHEER as Raya and Julia exchange a flurry of MOVES, KICKS and THROWS. Aged 17, Raya resembles a younger version of her mother - same JET BLACK HAIR -- PALE COMPLEXION -- HEAVY EYE SHADO Julia wallops Raya. The crowd BOO AND HISS -- pure pantom

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Shuttup -- or I'll stick my foot so far up your arse, you'll be using my big toe as a tongue. LAUGHS AND HISSES from the crowd. Ricky, lurking on the ropes, distracts the Referee, allowing Julia free-reign t pummel Raya. The crowd HOLLER in protest. Suddenly -- THRASH METAL plays -- a GRAVELLY VOCALIST sin chants ‘ZODIAK! ZODIAK! over razor-blade guitars. The crowd CHEER as Zak -- now 18, 6’2", BUZZ CUT, CHERUBI SMILE -- bolts from the wings and slides into the ring. He kicks Ricky in the belly and against the ropes. The blue-collar crowd ROAR -- kids open-mouthed, parents transfixed -- all transported by the show. Raya ELBOW SMASHES Julia to the mat -- the audience erupt

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Britani! Britani! Raya grandstands, milking the crowd like a pro, loving ev moment. A HANDFUL of die-hard Raya fans CHEER WILDLY for her, ho up signs. Among them, two YOUNGER, AWKWARD EMO TEENAGERS, HANNAH AND ELLIE. Zak comes for his dad --

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zak Attack! Zak Attack! Zak Attack! Zak brings Ricky down with a SWINGING LEG HOOK FIREMAN’S CARRY SLAM. Pins Ricky in a hold. Raya pins Julia. The Referee slides down next to them, pounds out the coun

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: One...! Two...! The crowd chant along: “One... two...”

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three! The crowd cheer -- Zak and Raya leap to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your winners -- Zak Zodiak -- and Britani! Zak raises his sister’s hand -- they look at one another. winks at Raya “Good job”. She grins, relishing the applau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Family are dismantling the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family carry the ring elements outside to a BEATEN-UP VAN branded with the W.A.W. insignia. Kaiser the dog, now fully grown, dances around their feet. I/E. VAN - NIGHT oO The rusting van rattles down GREAT YARMOUTH’S GOLDEN MILE creaking with old age. Ricky drives, Julia is holding up a mobile phone on speak In the rear, Zak and Raya lean in, listening keenly as an AMERICAN WOMAN answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: World Wrestling Entertainment. Hutch Bernad’s office.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (into phone) ‘Ello, luv. It’s Ricky Knight callin’ again.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ricky -- ?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: -- Knight. Well, Bevis is my real name. Patrick Bevis. From the World Association of Wrestling?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: The World Association of Wrestling. In Norwich.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Norwich, in England. Have you heard of England? Turn right at Greenland.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (calming him) Rick...

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What’s this regarding, sir?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I sent Mr. Bernad a tape. Of my kids Zak Zodiak and Britani --

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Well, in the ring I’m Britani. Out of the ring I’m Saraya.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: That’s ‘cause in the ring I’m Saraya. You might have heard of me? Sweet Saraya Knight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The easy way to remember it is: Julia is Saraya, Saraya is Britani, Pat Bevis is Ricky Knight and Zak Bevis is Zak Zodiak. Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You still there, luv?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m sure Mr. Bernad will contact you if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Has he watched the tape?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m sure Mr. Bernad will contact you if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Can you tell him we called again?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN WOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m sure Mr. Bernad will contact you if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Are you actually a real person?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Rick...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Thanks for all your help, luv. He hangs up. The whole Knight clan sigh heavily, frustrat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - VAN travels down an A-ROAD - VAN passes a SIGN that says “WELCOME TO NORWICH - A FIN CITY”. On through various streets.  9 EXT, STREETS - NIGHT Oo 9 Zak and Raya stare out at the Norwich suburbs from the W. van. Zak notices a solitary TEENAGER, sitting alone on a PLAYGROUND SWING-SET. It’s a melancholy sight. 10 EXT. COUNCIL ESTATE - NIGHT oO 10 The van slows as it approaches a COUNCIL HOUSE -- the Kni home. Suddenly -- a DEBT COLLECTOR appears as if from nowhere, waving a LEGAL LOOKING LETTER.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Rick, he’s here again!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, bollocks.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Drive! Drive! Ricky puts his foot down as the Debt Collector hollers:

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR
dialogues.text: Seven thousand, six hundred and fourteen pounds! The van speeds on --

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t run forever. We know who you are, Mr. Clondike!

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (to Ricky) Mr. Clondike? Ricky shrugs. They start LAUGHING. The van drives on -- 11 EXT. NORWICH STREETS - DAY oO 11 Zak is behind the wheel of the van now, steering past the boarded-up shops and grafittied walls of a RUN-DOWN WORKI CLASS SUBURB. Kaiser peers out from the backseat. A group of Young Kids are lying flat on their backs on th pavement in front of a plywood ramp. An older boy sitting in a shopping trolley is being pushe another at break-neck speed towards the ramp.  12 13 10. It’s clearly about to end in tears when -- Zak rolls up i the van and BEEPS the horn. The TROLLEY stops, inches from the ramp and calamity. The kids see the van -- and their faces light up. They abando what they’re doing, start to climb aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya hands out FLYERS to disinterested passers-by. She is helped by the TWO EMO TEENS who were in the crowd at the show: Hannah and Ellie -- both shy and reserved, now wear W.A.W. T-shirts. Most passers-by ignore them or brush them aside like flie

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Have you got a leaflet for the wrestlin’ tonight? Hello, sorry, I have somethin’ for wrestlin’... A MAN IN A BUSINESS SUIT happily takes a flyer -- then promptly spits his gum into it. Raya watches, disheartene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAULIE (15), THIN, WIRY, SHAVEN HEAD, is staring up at tw OLDER SKATER KIDS. They take drags on a joint.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Good, right? That’s the same shit Rihanna smokes. The Skater Kids take out their money as Paulie hands over little baggie of weed. Suddenly -- between the skater kid Paulie sees the W.A.W. van pull into view.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit... He grabs the cash from the Skater Kids, bolts in the oppo direction -- as Zak leaps from the van, powers after him. Paulie rips across a street -- hurtles a low brick wall i a FRONT GARDEN. Zak hurtles after him. Paulie enters the open FRONT DOOR of a HOUSE -- zips stra through the lounge past a LITTLE GIRL watching TV -- out back door. Zak streaks through the lounge without stopping.  14 11. Paulie stumbles out into the back garden. An OLD LADY han washing backs away in fright. Paulie is up and over the BACK FENCE into an alley -- but Zak's right behind him -- barrels down onto him, drags hi backwards. The OLD LADY peers over the fence -- as Zak ri through Paulie’s pockets, pulls out a few bags of weed an pills.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not mine.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Then why did you run?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: You said I should do more cardio.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (waving baggie) Who's is it then?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I dunno. (re: Old Lady) Hers? Zak clips him around the head.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Owww.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Get in the van. The Old Lady watches, confused, as Zak pushes Paulie down lane, dumping the drugs into a OPEN DUST-BIN. Beat. The Old Lady moves to the bin, looks around, retrieves th stash. Scurries inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya, Hannah and Ellie are still handing out flyers. TWO ATTRACTIVE TOWNIE GIRLS (LATE TEENS) wearing high-str fashions sashay past.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: S’cuse me. Have you ever been to live wrestlin’?  12. The TOWNIE’s look down their noses.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: (sneery) No.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE 2
dialogues.text: Who watches wrestling?

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Stupid people who think it’s real. Hannah looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE 2
dialogues.text: Are you a wrestler?

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: No. (re: Raya) She is. She’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: But she’s a girl. (looking Raya up and down) Aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE 2
dialogues.text: (smirking) Is this, like, your costume?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: No, this is me.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE 2
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Wait, aren’t you from that weird family?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: We're not weird.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Your brother’s in jail. Raya flinches.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Why don’t you come tonight? It’s fun.  15 13.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: I told you. We don’t like wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: How do you know if you’ve never been?

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: I’ve never had rectal bleeding but I’m pretty sure I’m not a fan of that either. Her friend snickers. Raya steps toward them both menacing

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Why don’t I stick her head up your arse, and you can find out? There is real threat in Raya’s eyes. The Townie’s scuttle off, unnerved. Then from a safe distance they call back -

dialogues.speaker: TOWNIE
dialogues.text: (calling back) Freaks! Hannah and Ellie look rattled. Raya calls after the Towni

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Yeah, we are. And proud of it! She grins at Hannah and Ellie, who smile back. The girls return to flyer-ing. Zak's theme tune -- THRASH METAL chorus of ‘ZODIAK! ZODIA plays as a ringtone. Raya pulls out her phone. Answers.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Zak... I/E. VAN - DAY ro} 15 Zak drives, Raya shot-gun, assorted local kids -- like ST CATS over-running the back seats -- sing along to the HEA METAL TRACK on the stereo. (say ‘ENTER SANDMAN’ by Metallica.)

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: “Take my hand... we're off to never- never land!" They stop at the lights.  16 14. Zak glances out of the window: he sees the TEENAGER again sitting alone on the SWING-SET. The van drives on past -- then does a U-TURN in the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak and Raya approach the teen, CALUM (16).

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Hello, mate. My name’s Zak. This is my sister Saraya. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: CALUM
dialogues.text: Calum.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Nice to meet ya. We run a wrestling school. Grapplers Gym. Lot of local people your age come down, if you fancy it? Calum shakes “no”.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No? Ever done any wrestling, mate?

dialogues.speaker: CALUM
dialogues.text: Don’t take the piss. Calum picks up a WHITE CANE -- slowly walks away. We real - along with Zak and Raya -- that he is partially-sighted Zak looks at his sister. He scurries after Calum tenaciou Raya follows.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Wrestling is the nuts, mate. It doesn’t matter what problems you have in real life, when you’re in the ring you’re invincible.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Yeah. You can make the audience laugh, cry, boo, cheer. For ten minutes you feel like God. Calum stops, snaps at them --

dialogues.speaker: CALUM
dialogues.text: I can't see!  17 15.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: So? What else you gonna do today? Listen to porn? Calum walks off. Raya and Zak look at one another, watch go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slam! STOCKY PRO-WRESTLERS work out a routine in a TATTY held together with DUCK TAPE. Others use creaking WORK-OUT EQUIPMENT. We’re in a WINDOW-LESS WAREHOUSE brightened by GAUDY POST of GURNING WRESTLERS promoting previous W.A.W. clashes. Kaiser lies in a basket, one eye on Zak giving instructio The Strays in a SECOND RING. Zak has a Stray in a half-nelson -- drops him to the mat pins him.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Now, you lock off the whole of the body, ‘cause the objective is -- ?

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Get a three count or a submission!

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Good. Now you. The Strays begin to repeat the action. Paulie, standing behind Raya, grips her in a half-nelson.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Paulie -- have you got a hard on? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: It’s not my fault, it does what it wants.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Uggghhh. Paulie! Raya spins out of the HALF-NELSON as Paulie covers his gr

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Fifty press-ups.  18 16.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: For having a stiffy?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No. For being sexually aroused by my sister. How desperate are you? More LAUGHTER, as Raya punches Zak in the arm. Paulie dro to the mat. Everyone begins to count his PUSH UPS -- as R sees something -- gestures -- Zak follows her gaze -- -- Calum is making his way into the gym. Zak smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky is sitting at a desk, speaking on an old LAND-LINE TELEPHONE. Julia sits doing paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (into phone) You're killin’ us, Glenn, it ain’t worth him makin’ the trip for that... Wait, let me ask him... A HULKING WRESTLER wearing a UNION JACK WAISTCOAT is sitt next to Ricky. Ricky picks up a METAL TRASH CAN LID.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you take one o’ them in the face?

dialogues.speaker: UNION JACK
dialogues.text: Dunno. What’s it like? Ricky smacks him in the face with the lid. Union Jack nod unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, that’s fine... Hang on. Ricky pulls a BOWLING BALL out of a box, stands above Uni Jack, drops the BALL in his groin. Jack doubles over in p Then, in agony, gives a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, he’1ll do a bowlin’ ball in the bollocks. How much...? Glenn, pay him what he’s worth! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (resigned) Okay. He’1l be there. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sixty quid. Union Jack rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Union Jack gets up, exits -- as Julia finishes counting takings.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much last night?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Four hundred.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Bloody hell. If things don’t pick up soon I‘ll have to go back to thievin’.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I don’t care how desperate we get, you are never going back to thievin’. We’ll make Zak do it. And Raya can go on the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH, share a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak helps Calum into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Everyone. This is Calum.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Hello, Calum. Nearby, a pro-wrestler slams onto a mat. Calum flinches.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You're okay, mate. Calum remains tense.  18.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you see anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: CALUM
dialogues.text: Outlines.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can you see me?

dialogues.speaker: CALUM
dialogues.text: I can see a blob.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Close enough. Everyone LAUGHS -- including Calum.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: How’s he gonna wrestle if he can’t see?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You can see. Doesn't help you. Everyone LAUGHS again. Raya whispers to Zak.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Seriously, how is he?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Courtney! Everyone looks round. COURTNEY, (18), PRETTY, QUIET, has entered. She nods to Zak. He nods back, looks to his sister...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can me and Courts have a word... 20 MOMENTS LATER -—— 20 Through a window we WATCH -- but don’t HEAR -- as Zak and Courtney share something with Raya. Her reaction is WILD SURPRISE.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA, (PRE LAP)
dialogues.text: They can take us as they find us, or not at all.  21 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya sets the table. Ricky is sat in his WIFE-BEATER VEST reading THE DAILY STAR. Julia blitzes TV DINNERS in the microwave, arguing with Z

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I’m not asking you to bow and scrape, it’s just Courtney's parents are quite --

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Posh.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Her dad is teetotal.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he’s teetotal out of choice, not ‘cause he’s an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, la-de-dah.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: He just wants to make a good impression when they get here.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Make a good impression, how?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can you put a shirt on for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) How fuckin’ posh are they?!

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Why’s a posh bird goin’ out with a wrestler?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: ‘Cause he told her he’s gonna be rich and famous.  22 20.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No. ‘Cause I’m kind and considerate... except in the bedroom, when I’m an animal.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA RICKY
dialogues.text: Ugghhh! That’s my boy! Learned from the master.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And can we keep the effin’ and jeffin’ to a fuckin’ minimum? Courtney’s dad don’t use cusswords.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Who is her dad? The Archbishop of fuckin’ Canterbury?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Please, can we just try and act normal? For Courtney’s sake. Off Julia and Ricky’s nods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Family are sitting around the dining table eating din Ricky is now wearing a Norwich City soccer shirt. Zak is next to Courtney. Opposite them are DAPHNE and HUGH -- a MIDDLE-AGED, MIDDL CLASS, MIDDLE-ENGLAND COUPLE -- wildly out of place besid the tattooed and pierced Knight family.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (best behavior) Can I say, on behalf of my husband and I, that we are delighted to finally make your acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh... well, likewise. Julia winks at Zak -- who smiles, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: More expensive sparkling water, Hugh?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: Thank you.  21. Ricky pours water for Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Courtney says you’re in stocks and shares, Hugh?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: For my sins. And... you’re all wrestlers?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: All of us, mate, that’s right.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Who exactly enjoys wrestling?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Loads of people, luv.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: Just no one we know, dear.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Isn’t it all fake? The Knight family bristle at the word.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: If it was all fake, Daph, would I have broken my leg three times? My collar bone twice?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Would me elbow bend like this? He shows them his elbow. It’s lumpy, mis-shapen, and bend a weird angle. Daphne and Hugh wince.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: That’s nothin’. You should see his cock.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Mum...

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Sorry. (to Daphne and Hugh) His penis.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: How did you get into wrestling?  22.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (grinning) Oh, this is such a romantic story. Do you want to tell it?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: No, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Well, when I met Rick I was thinkin’ of killing meself.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: She wanted to top herself, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I'd been abused and livin’ on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: And I'd done eight years of prison. Zak rolls his eyes. Hugh and Daphne glance at one another taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Prison? For... what?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Mainly violence.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Mainly violence, yep.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: And a bit of armed robbery. Zak looks at Raya: “not this”. Daphne and Hugh shift uncomfortably. Flick a glance at Courtney: who are these people?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me and my mob come back from doin’ a job in London. And Julia come in and saw all the cash and sawn-off shot-guns on the kitchen table. And I knew from the look in her eyes that if I didn’t give all that up there and then, I’d lose her forever.  23.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: He walked out on his gang that night -- never done another dishonest day in his life.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: And the rest of ‘em are all banged up now, aren’t they? Or dead.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: One of them had his face blown off.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (correcting) Half his face.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Some people find religion. Me and Ricky found wrestlin’. Julia and Ricky look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was our salvation, wasn’t it? They start making out like teenagers. Hugh and Daphne watch, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: (to Hugh) That’s a romantic story, isn’t it, dad?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: Yes... considering a man got his face blown off.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Half his face. Zak senses Daphne and Hugh’s discomfort. The PHONE RINGS. Ricky answers.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Ello...? This is he... Yeah, they’re here, hang on... RICKY puts the phone on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Am I speaking to Zak and Britani?  24.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK/RAYA
dialogues.text: Yep./Hello.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: My name is Hutch Bernad, I’m calling from WWE. Zak and Raya look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were very impressed by your tape. In April we’re bringing Smackdown to the 02 in London and we'd like you both to come down -- and try out for us. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Would you excuse us while we check our diaries? He MUTES the call. Zak and Raya look at one another -- th at their parents -- then back at one another -- -- and then ERUPT! WHOOP -- HOLLER -- HUGS -- HIGH-FIVES. Zak kisses Courtne Ricky kisses Julia. Even Kaiser BARKS like he’s won the lottery. Daphne and Hugh look blank. Zak shushes everyone. Clicks the phone off MUTE.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (super calm) Yes, we think we can clear a space in our schedule.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good. We'll be in touch. See you both there.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Thank you. The call ends. The celebrations pick right up again -- un Daphne pipes up --  23 25.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Excuse me? What is the WWE?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: OH FUCK OFF
dialogues.text: Daphne and Hugh recoil. INT. KNIGHT HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT oO 23 The Knight's are screening a CLASSIC WWE match on TV for Daphne and Hugh. On screen, two female WWE Divas do battl The crowd chant: “This is awesome!"

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: For any wrestler, making it big, it's this -- in America, with the WWE.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: World Wrestling Entertainment. Biggest wrestlin' company in the world.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: America is where the money is, where the stardom is.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: We get there, we’ll be travellin’ the world, on private jets, performin’ in front of millions. You can make millions.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Movies even.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: You should see her in the ring. It's like watchin’ a brilliant ballet dancer. And the biggest buzz I get is when people say to me, “Don't she look just like you?”

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: When they’re stars and they come back, we’ll have full houses every night, shift a ton of merchandise, expand the trainin’ school, sky's the limit. (to Hugh) You should buy shares in us, mate.  26. Hugh LAUGHS FAINTLY.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seriously, I’ve got the paperwork here.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: (to Zak) Do you think you’1ll get signed?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Signed? I been trainin’ him for this before he had fur on his bollocks. Nads. Knackers. Testicles. Raya points to a framed photo of another YOUNG MAN dresse a Zebra-print leotard.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Our step-brother Roy did the try- outs last year.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh. Is Roy in America now?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: No. He's in prison.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Oh. And why’s he --?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY JULIA
dialogues.text: Mainly violence. Mainly violence. Daphne and Hugh look unnerved. Zak steps in.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: This is not the only exciting news today, is it? She takes Zak’s hand. Everyone looks at them expectantly. COURTNEY (CONT’D) I've decided to quit college... and move in with Zak.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Since... I got pregnant.  27. Both sets of parents stare, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: Fuccckkkkkkkkk! Everyone stares at Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (to Hugh) Don’t worry. The baby’s mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya, Zak and Courtney sit at a table across from a BIG G in PRISON GARB. This is ROY (28). He has his hand on Courtney’s growing baby-bump.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Did you feel him kick?

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Practicing his drop-kicks in there. He's gonna be a wrestler.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Please God, no. Everyone LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Have you picked a name?

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: We're thinking about Kayden.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: I love it.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I need a name, too.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: You're not pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: No. WWE have got a Britani. I have to chose a new name before the try- out. Any ideas? An immediate barrage from the brothers.  28.

dialogues.speaker: ROY ZAK
dialogues.text: Scrubber, Slutbucket, Trollop, The Norwich Bicycle, Margaret Snatcher Sabrina The Teenage Bitch

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Moobs McGee.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks boys. The siblings laugh.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Roy... can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: ‘Course you can.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Your mum said you did the try-outs last year?

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: So why are you in here? The siblings stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Courts...

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna be rude, but Zak won’t tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Courtney... Roy looks at Zak, then at Raya. They all shift uncomforta Courtney stares defiantly. Looks at Raya for support.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: She's havin’ your kid, Zak. She's family now. Zak takes this in. Exchanges a look with Roy. Roy takes a breath, addresses Courtney:

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: I did the try-outs. The WWE didn't want me. I took it hard. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Started drinkin'. One night I'm in a boozer, some geezers come in, I picked a fight with 'em. No reason, just went at it. One bloke comes at me, I picked up a fire extinguisher... Roy looks down, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: ROY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put him in a coma for six weeks.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: (hand to her mouth) Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: He's fine now. Courtney leans back in her seat, shocked. She looks at Za worried.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Don't worry, love. Zak ain't like me. I’m the nutcase. He’s the strong one in the family. Courtney looks to Raya, who nods in confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: ROY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really. Zak’s got his head screwed on. Him and Moobs McGee here. Courtney smiles, accepting the reassurance. CLOSE ON: Raya, nodding, but a note of disquiet on her fa EXT. BRITANNIA ROAD —- NORWICH HILLSIDE - DAY 25 PAN FROM: The BRICK FACADE of the 19th century PRISON, ac the skyline of Norwich. Zak and Raya race each other up the steep hill. Zak wins, Raya close behind. They suck in air, framed by the their hometown in the distance. Zak notices Raya’s thousand yard stare.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: ‘Course.  30.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I know when you're lying.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Just... thinking about Roy. And the trial.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: If we get signed, we'll have to leave all this.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: And move to a mansion in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Four thousand miles away.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: From a council house in Norwich.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: From mum and dad. Everyone. Zak studies his sister. She looks anxious.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: What’s this about?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Zak reads her nervousness. Pulls her close, reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You're gonna smash it tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You're a Knight -- wrestling's in your blood.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: That's not good. That makes it sound like... hepatitis.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: It is. You're riddled with wrestlin' -- and there's no cure.  26 31. Raya LAUGHS. She pushes Zak and he stumbles back, giving a head start, as she races off, and we --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Camera following Zak and Raya through a TUNNEL into -- INT. ARENA - pay [J 26 The sibling’s eyes widen as they take in the VAST AUDITOR The 20,000 seats are empty -- but the STAGE is already be set for tonight's WWE rumble. BANNERS and BRANDING are be hoisted into place -- technicians adjust lights -- camera are trained on the WRESTLING RING in the middle of the fl Zak is open-mouthed with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: So cool. Can you imagine this place, full, twenty-thousand people -- Zodiak! Zodiak! Raya looks around the vast auditorium, overwhelmed by it’ scale. She sees the competition limbering up -- EIGHT GUYS, shoulders bulging, abs shredded.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're the only girl. Raya considers this -- anxiety rising. Zak notices some movement up in the stands. Nudges Raya, upwards -- she looks -- DWAYNE ‘THE ROCK’ JOHNSON is talking and bro-hugging some fellow WWE STARS. Raya looks at Zak: “holy shit.”

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Two lines -- fall in! A VOICE reverberates around the vast arena. It belongs to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Contenders line up in formation. Hutch, flanked by two ASSISTANT TRAINERS, studies them li DRILL SERGEANT.  27 32.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Who is here because they want to be a WWE superstar? All hands raise.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Then let's address the elephant in the room. He turns to a HUGE HEAVEYSET DUDE in a wrestling leotard.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How's it going? Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are the odds are of becoming a WWE superstar? Heavyset Dude shrugs “I don’t know”.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The same as you ordering salad for lunch -- zero. (to group) You have better odds of making it in the NFL, the NBA or the Soccer Premier League -- than of becoming a WWE superstar. Odds are you will never play a stadium. Never get on TV. Never win a Title Belt. Hutch holds up a WWE Championship Belt and a Diva’s Championship Belt. He gestures to another Contender.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most of you will be as disappointed as this guy’s wife on their wedding night. So let’s get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCHLAMM! A BLACK ADONIS hits the mat hard. He and Zak battle in the ring. Raya watches Hutch as he studies Zak. She looks up at Dwayne, who chats with his fellow wrestle eyes on the trials.

dialogues.speaker: BLOW UP DRILLS
dialogues.text: - Hutch scrutinises as the contenders run in circles arou the base of the ring, jump up, then squat down to touch t floor. - Side-to-side leaps over heavy weight bags at rapid pace - Forward rolls.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RING
dialogues.text: Raya and Zak give a virtuoso display of CLASSIC BRITISH WRESTLING TECHNIQUE. PUSH IN ON: Hutch, studying them. UP IN THE STANDS: Dwayne watches attentively. Zak and Raya lock up. Zak whispers to his sister.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Play everything out more. And sell your snaps harder. Raya absorbs, nods. They break apart. Zak takes Raya in a ‘pigsfoot’ -- slaps her around the fa She administers Zak's advice -- snapping her head back dramatically. Hutch observes.

dialogues.speaker: MORE BLOW UP DRILLS
dialogues.text: - Hutch shouting abuse, scanning them for weaknesses. - Zak and Raya BOUNCE against the ropes, drop to do a pre up, jump over a weight bag, into another press up. - Hutch watches as one contender gives up, staggers to a trash can, vomits inside.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE RING
dialogues.text: Zak drops a LONG HAIRED DUDE with his ‘Zak Attack’ finish move. Pins him for the ‘win’. A shimmer of satisfaction crosses Hutch’s face.  34.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Nice finisher. That your move?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (nodding) The Zak Attack. Hutch nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Contenders hang on the ropes, exhausted, as Hutch pro in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Becoming a WWE Superstar is all about winning. But not a match -- who wins, who loses, the producers decide that before you ever step in the ring. What you have to win... is the crowd. What do we call winning the crowd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak raises a hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Going over.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Going over. And no one’s ever gone over bigger than a man we’re lucky to have with us today. He gestures to the stands.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dwayne... I’m puttin’ you on the spot... but would you show ‘em how it’s done...? Dwayne looks at the other pro’s in the stands, who gee hi into it. The contenders applaud as he makes his way down.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RING
dialogues.text: Dwayne holds the mic, throws back his head, raises the mi his lips.  35.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Finally... the Rock has come back to Lon-don! Everyone CLAPS wildly. Zak grins and CHEERS with unbridle glee. Dwayne points at a Contender.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name? The Contender opens his mouth to speak -- but Dwayne cuts off.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: IT DOESN'T MATTER WHAT YOUR NAME
dialogues.text: IS! The Rock says know your role and shut your mouth. The Rock is standing here -- like the man and a half he is -- ready to do to you exactly what he does best and that's lay the smack down on your candy ass! Everyone APPLAUDS. Dwayne smiles --

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: We call that what? Zak's hand is in the air.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: A promo.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Dwayne’1l tell ya, apart from your skill in the ring, promos are how you connect with the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Right. This is a fictionalized world but the fans can tell if you're being fake. You go over when the fans connect with the real you. The Rock is me, but with the bass, the treble, the volume dialled way up. Hutch points at Zak.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What’s your name?  36.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Zak Zodiak.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Zak Zodiak? What are you, a stripper at a gay bar? LAUGHS from the other wannabes.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds. Why are you here? Go...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: When I was three years old, I could name every WWE wrestler just by looking at his boots; I’ve wanted to be one of ‘em ever since. I eat, sleep and dream wrestlin’. I’m passionate, I’m determined and I’m the toughest bastard in the room. Oh, I shouldn’t curse, we have ladies present -- He turns to Raya -- leans past her to the LONG HAIRED DUD

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, miss. Everyone LAUGHS. LONG HAIRED DUDE looks embarrassed. Dway LAUGHS, leads the applause. Hutch turns to Raya.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What’s your name? Raya hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Er... Paige.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Paige? Whadda you, wrestle -- or sell perfume at the mall? LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you here? Go!

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I’m here because I’m the best, you're just one of the rest. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen because you can run but you can’t hide --

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! He waves his hands, closing her down.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did Dwayne just say the fans connect with?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: The... real you. Hutch pushes himself into her face.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Then why you speakin’ in cliches? Go again, show us the real you -- or you can get on your broomstick and fly your ass home to Hogwarts. All eyes turn to Raya. Dwayne looks at her, expectant. Long pause. She eyeballs Hutch. TITTERS.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: When are you gonna drop this army drill-sergeant bollocks? You’re not trainin’ us to fight in Iraq, you're trainin’ us to fight in spandex.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My whole family are wrestlers, I’ve been wrestling since before I was born. Literally. My mum was seven months pregnant with me and didn’t even realize, so she was still gettin’ in the ring every night, which meant I was, too. Dwayne leans forward, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sending me home is not a threat, I'll go back to fightin’ with my family and be happy doin’ it. I got options -- but if this is my competition --  30 38. She gestures to the other dudes.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- you sure as shit don’t. She leans into Hutch’s face.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. And your breath stinks. So either brush your teeth -- or stop kissin’ Dwayne Johnson's ass. Everyone looks from Hutch to Dwayne for a reaction. Dwayn smiles. Shares a look with Hutch -- who moves on to the n contender, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Contenders wait anxiously, in silence. Zak paces nervously. Raya chews her nails. They meet each others gaze but say nothing: too much at stake for chit-c

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that true? Your whole family are wrestlers? They turn. It’s Dwayne, with his team.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (shocked) Fuck me dead, bury me pregnant. Dwayne raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: She means yes.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Mine, too.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I know. Your granddad was High Chief Peter Maivia. Your dad was “Soulman” Rocky Johnson, he was in the first black tag team to win the World Championship.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: He’s a huge fan.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Massive.  39.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: He’s been a fan since you had hair. Dwayne raises another eyebrow. Looks at them both.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Well, good luck to ya. He begins to head off.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a favour? Dwayne turns back.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Don’t put him on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: He won’t mind. As we’re both from wrestlin’ families, would you --

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: -- vouch for you? Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No, no. I was wonderin’ if you could ‘Rock-Bottom’ me?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I... don't really do that either.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Please. One of my all time dreams is to be Bottomed by The Rock.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: If I Bottom you, people will see. I‘1l have to Bottom them.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No one's lookin’. Please, just a quick Bottom, I'll be out of your hair.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Not hair. Don’t say hair. Dwayne considers.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Okay, quick. Ready?  31 40. Zak nods. Dwayne side-slams Zak to the floor. Zak winces “Bagh”.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Car keys. Back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Good luck, guys. I’1l be keeping tabs on you.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can you call me a jabroni? But Dwayne is gone. Zak and Raya grin at one another, as helps him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya and Zak -- amidst the other Contenders -- stand in l in silence, trying not to betray their nerves. Hutch stands before them --

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: We will be offering four of you a contract with WWE. You'll join us out in Florida at our development division, NXT. For the rest of you - - I’m afraid -- this is the end of the line. Raya reaches for her brother’s hand, squeezes it tightly.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The first person chosen is -- CLOSE ON the contenders, holding their breath -- wishing praying.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hugh Jabs. The LONG HAIRED DUDE punches the air in celebration.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But change your ring name.  41. Long Haired Dude cuts his celebration short.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The second person is -- Captain Kronos. A GERMANIC BEEFCAKE drops to his knees, thanking the Gods

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The third person is... Zak and Raya breathe deeply.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paige.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Are you fuckin’ serious?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I’m fuckin’ serious.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Omigod, omigod, omigod. She turns to her brother -- SCREAMS SILENTLY -- hugs him. hugs her back.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: And the last person is -- CLOSE ON: Zak, never more focused. Time slows down -- TV talent show tension.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- Joey Midnight. The BLACK ADONIS nods, kisses the crucifix around his nec Zak is paralysed -- uncomprehending. Raya, too.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you all for coming today. Hutch and his Colleagues walk away -- winners and rejects slowly disperse. Zak can’t move -- stares blankly -- Raya doesn’t know wha do -- or say. Finally, Zak breaks the silence. Turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I’m proud of you.  32 33 42.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: This is not right... She starts to run after Hutch --

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Raya... -- but she is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long circular corridor -- buzz of pre-show activity. Raya dashes past technicians, wrestlers, assistants, searching for Hutch -- dips her head into empty rooms -- can’t find him. Zak trails some distance behind her -- still shell-shocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch is climbing into an SUV. Suddenly Raya appears, Zak behind her.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You have to take my brother.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I made my choices.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I don’t make mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Then how do you explain that goatee?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Raya...

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: If my brother’s not going, neither am I.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Raya!  43.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Is that a threat?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA ZAK
dialogues.text: Yes. No.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every week two thousand people beg me for the chance I just gave you. I have options. You don’t. So you have ten seconds to tell me: do you want this or not?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Not without Zak.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Eight seconds.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Coach, she wants it... Raya and Hutch lock eyes. Stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Six...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Raya...

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Five...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You're not just doing this for you -- it’s for the family. Family. That word again.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: ...three...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Raya!

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I want this. Zak breathes a sigh of relief. Hutch stares at Raya defiantly.  34 35

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: See you in Florida. He climbs into the SUV -- and it roars away. Raya watches go, turns -- to see Zak wandering away. I/E. VAN - EVENING oO 34 Zak and Raya drive home in silence. Raya glances at her brother -- but he stares only at the road. She knows ther nothing she can say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, Julia, Courtney, the Strays and the Pros are waiti anxiously. Car doors illuminate the gym. Everyone rises to their fee Doors slam outside. Beat. Zak and Raya walk in -- greeted by a wall of expectant fa

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Well -- ?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Saraya’s in... I’m not. Ricky’s shoulders slump. Julia, never at a loss for somet to say, cannot find the right words. Even Kaiser sits silently. Zak breaks the ice.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you all so quiet? Come on! My little sister is the first eighteen-year-old English girl signed by the WWE -- ever! He begins to CLAP AND WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Champagne! Paulie, go down the shop and nick some champagne. Taking their lead from Zak, everyone else joins in the applause. Courtney kisses Zak, gives him a hug.  36 37 38 45.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (nodding) Fine. Julia hugs her daughter -- then gently touches the back o Zak's head -- whispers in his ear. Ricky gives Raya a bear hug, looks Zak in the eye -- shak his hand manfully -- pats him on the shoulder. The Strays crowd around Raya to congratulate her. Zak watches, stoically, as they hoist her on their should and parade her around the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds drag themselves across a grey sky. INT. RAYA’S BEDROOM - DAY 37 Raya is finishing packing her SUITCASE. On her bed sits a vintage ULTIMATE WARRIOR WRESTLING BUDD CUDDLY TOY from the 90s. Raya picks up Ultimate Warrior, him in her case. She looks around her TEENAGE ROOM for the last time. Look PHOTOS on a shelf: the family in wrestling costumes, stri FIGHTING POSES; Raya with Zak, wearing his PINK POWER RAN OUTFIT -- from the night Raya first got in the ring. She puts both pictures in her case -- and snaps it closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON ZAK -- sitting on the old BENCH PRESS, taking dr on a cigarette. Julia appears at the back door -- Raya behind her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Zak, we're off.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (waking from his thoughts) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: To the airport. Chop chop...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I can't come right now...

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Your sister's leavin’ for America.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I've got a ton of stuff to do...

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What do you have to do?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What stuff?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Mum, it's fine, if he's busy... Julia mutters, shakes her head, walks off inside. Brother and sister look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Have a safe flight... and... good luck and everything...

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: And you... with the baby, and... Zak nods. They embrace. Stilted. Awkward. Raya turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Don't cry. She turns back.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At the airport. If you cry, mum'll start -- and if you see her cryin’, you won't wanna go. When you walk to the plane, just put your hood up -- and don't look back.  39 40 4l 47. Raya nods, appreciating the advice. She leaves. Zak finds himself all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya hugs Roy goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From an UPSTAIRS WINDOW, Zak silently watches as the van carries his sister away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Julia look on as Wrestlers and Strays say goodb to Raya. Hannah nudges Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: Go on... Ellie nervously hands Raya a rolled piece of paper. Raya unfolds it -- it’s a beautifully detailed, Manga- influenced, hand-drawn ILLUSTRATION of Raya, posing on th top rope, pumping her fist and smiling, as she holds alof the WWE DIVA CHAMPIONSHIP BELT. Fan-art at it’s finest. Raya -- overwhelmed -- admires the picture.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You drew this? Ellie nods.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: It's you, winning the Diva's title. Raya smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: It’s amazing. Thank you. She thanks them with a hug. ANGLE ON: Ricky and Julia.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: She's ain’t comin’ back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘Course she's comin’ back. She's goin’ out to work, not die.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: She's goin’ away to live.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: It's gonna be alright. You just gotta be strong.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: I'm trying, Rick.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Once the gates close, you'll have a good ol' cry. She's gotta walk on that plane on her own. At least we go home together. Raya approaches her parents.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I'm really scared now. I wish Zak was comin’.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: We all do, luv.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Look after him.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: He’ll be fine. He’s the tough one in the family. Julia starts to tear up. Raya is emotional now, too.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Go and get 'em baby, okay? You're amazing. You're absolutely amazing.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You're gonna be a star, Princess -- you're gonna put our family name on the map.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Which family name?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Either’s fine. Raya smiles.  42 43 44 49. Paulie lifts her carry-on onto her shoulder. She gives hi peck on the cheek and he steps back, grinning. Raya moves towards the DEPARTURE GATE.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So long, luv. We’re proud of ya.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (waving to everyone) I love you. I love you. Julia is crying hard. Ricky puts an arm around her. ANGLE ON: Raya, as she puts up her hood -- trying to igno the tears streaming down her mother’s face. ORLANDO, FLORIDA -- ESTABLISHING SHOTS oO 42 POV from a CAR WINDOW -- endless blue-sky -- palm trees - sun glistening off Lake Eola. Raya takes in the alien landscape from the window of a TA Like Dorothy landing in Oz, her world seems to have gone black and white to Technicolor. She’s a long way from hom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya enters through a gate, takes in the SWIMMING POOL. THREE BEAUTIFUL WOMEN sunbathe. JERI-LYNN (Southern-belle pneumatic Playmate-type with fa boobs), MADISON (former dancer) and KIRSTEN (statuesque blonde). Kirsten looks up at Raya - flashes pearl blue eyes and gleaming white teeth -- as she dives elegantly into the p Raya hauls her bags up a staircase to a SECOND FLOOR WALK INT. RAYA’S APARTMENT - DAY 44 Raya unlocks the door, enters, takes in her new corporate clean home.  45 46 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATE OF THE ART training facility -- pristine WRESTLING RINGS branded with WWE NXT logos -- an even longer way fr the W.A.W. From the ring, Hutch explains a routine, demonstrated at speed by his TWO COLLEAGUES. Raya’s eyes wander -- she takes in the other new recruits EIGHT MEN, THREE WOMEN. The BOYS: LONG HAIRED DUDE, GERMANIC BEEFCAKE and BLACK ADONIS from the London trials -- plus an assortment of bo builders, college quarterbacks, all-American high school heroes and meathead farm-boys. The GIRLS from the pool: JERI-LYNN, MADISON and KIRSTEN. Each has the bombshell physique and pin-up good-looks of archetypal WWE DIVA -- SEXY OUTFIT, MANICURED NAILS, RICH TANS, COIFFURED HAIR. Raya looks down at her own TATTY BLACK LEGGINGS, FADING R T-SHIRT and SPLIT ENDS. Her porcelain-skin and Goth-rock mark her out -- as the runt of the litter. She looks up -- finds Kirsten staring at her. Kirsten fla a smile and a mouthful of gleaming white teeth. Raya smil back. ANGLE ON: Hutch’s colleagues, as they now demo the sequen at full speed. Applause. Hutch turns to the Class.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Everyone got it?

dialogues.speaker: CLASS
dialogues.text: Yes, Coach! Hutch points to Raya and Madison.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You and you. Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya and Madison lock up. They repeat the routine. Raya f through the memorised moves effortlessly.  51. They approach the final moves -- when Raya improvises -- Madison is not expecting it -- reacts slowly -- takes Ray FOOT IN THE FACE. Madison’s nose explodes in a cloud-burst of red.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: Agghh!!!

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Omigod, I’m so sorry! Raya rushes to help Madison -- who angrily pushes her awa clutching her bloodied nose. Kirsten clicks her fingers, points to a towel -- Jeri-Lynn grabs it, hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: (to Jeri-Lynn) Call the doc. Hutch jumps into the ring -- Kirsten follows, hands him t towel to smother the bleeding. Hutch examines Madison's n

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: It’s not broken. Someone call the doc...

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: On the way.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (to Madison) I’m so sorry. Hutch spins on Raya, angry. The class all turn to watch.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Did I tell you to add your own moves?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (apologetic) I’m sorry, I thought she’d know what I was doing.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Did I tell you to add your own moves? Raya shakes her head “no”.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then why did you?  52.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Your routine seemed kind of... basic.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Basic?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: My step-brother taught me that stuff when I was, like, ten.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Your step-brother?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Roy Bevis. (off Hutch’s blank look) The Zebra Kid?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (US pronunciation) The Zeebra Kid?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (correcting) Zebb-ra. Hutch steps forward, looms in Raya’s face. Raya nods.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I don’t care if you were taught by the Zebra Kid, the Elephant Man or the fuckin’ Lion King -- this ain't the ass-crack of England anymore, this is the NXT. If you want any chance of makin’ it on to the Main Roster, you do what I say, when I say it, or you can fuck off back home to The Addams Family. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I’m just sayin’, I --

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Yes, Coach. Hutch walks away.  53. Raya finds everyone eyeing her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN, (PRE LAP)
dialogues.text: One minute she’s like, “I’m an expert” --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsten and Jeri-Lynn are sunbathing.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: -- and the next minute she’s “Oh sorry, it was an accident”. So it’s like, are you an expert or not? (then) I can’t understand half of what she says. She sounds like she has a dick in her mouth... but not ina good way. Raya appears. Jeri-Lynn stops speaking. Flashes a smile.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Sorry about before. With Madison. It was an accident. I didn’t realize until, like, two months ago she was just a cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lot of times the WWE hire cheerleaders or models, girls who just wanna jiggle their tits and ass, you know, get famous -- instead of girls who’ve actually wrestled before.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: Where did you wrestle before?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: W.A.W. in England. I was Ladies Champion, Tag Team Champion and Ladies Hardcore Champion. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: I was a cheerleader. Beat.  48 49 50 54.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Cool. (to Jeri-Lynn) And what about --

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: Model. Raya nods. What can she say...? Kirsten flashes her thousand-watt smile.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: Well... nice to meet you. She gets up, walks towards her apartment. Jeri-Lynn smile too, follows. Off Raya’s sinking expression --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUN burns down on The Class as Hutch puts them throug merciless BLOW UP DRILLS: bellybusters -- atomic sit ups squatting with KETTLE BELLS -- suplexing WEIGHT BAGS. Hutch shouts abuse -- hollers commands -- scanning them f weaknesses. Black Adonis vomits. Shamefully buries it und sand. CLOSE ON: Raya, pushing herself, sweating hard. She locks eyes with Hutch, as he studies her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Courtney sweating hard, too -- deep into LABOUR Medical staff attend to her -- Zak watches. Courtney reac out, grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Class race along the beach in a BURDEN RUN, heavy sandbags slung over their shoulders. It’s gruelling work. Raya feels eyes on her. It’s Kirsten: she flashes her thousand watt smile, seemingly unfazed by the brutal regi - powers forward -- an unspoken challenge to Raya to keep Raya, sweating hard, pushes herself to catch up...  51 52 53 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak is handed his new-born son KAYDEN. He holds him awkwardly, stares into his eyes. Panic more than joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsten is in the lead, Raya behind her -- followed by Je Lynn, then Madison. Kirsten reaches a HEAVY TRACTOR TIRE. Dumps her sandbag - wrestles her tire upwards. Raya catches up -- struggles to get under her tire. Sweat hard, she gives herself an extra boost -- flipping her ti over -- trying to catch up with Kirsten. Jeri-Lynn is close behind. Raya soldiers through pain but Kirsten powers on -- gives FINAL PUSH. Crosses the ‘finish line’ -- victorious. Raya, lungs working overtime, arrives behind her in secon place. She drops, exhausted. Finds Kirsten staring at her with steel-cold eyes. Jeri-Lynn slumps down next to them. Madison is way behind, still doggedly trying to hoist her tire. It’s a losing battle. Hutch hollers at her.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Flip it!

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: It’s too hard...

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: How you gonna throw a girl round a ring every night if you can’t even flip a tire? Now flip it! Madison shakes her head, drops the tire, waves her hands defeat, collapses to the ground, sucking air. Raya watches as Hutch shakes his head in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatty trainers pounding down a pavement. A blur of limbs faces. Paulie runs for his life, pursued by TWO TWENTY- SOMETHING STREET TOUGHS.  54 56. The Toughs are gaining on Paulie as he dodges a car -- te across the industrial estate towards the W.A.W. gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak (blindfolded) is counting steps with Calum from one s of the ring to the other. They reach one side, turn, walk back. Strays work-shop in the other ring. Paulie BARRELS through the door, lungs in overdrive. A Stray nudges Zak and he lifts his blindfold -- to see t Toughs skid into the doorway. Zak quickly assesses the situation.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH
dialogues.text: No. (re: Paulie) We just need our friend here.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: He’s busy.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Hand-washing our jock-straps. The Toughs stride towards Paulie. Union Jack steps toward them, intimidatingly. The Toughs back down.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH
dialogues.text: (to Paulie) Stay off our fuckin’ patch. They leave. Zak turns to Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Empty your pockets.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I ain’t got nothin’...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Empty your pockets.  57. Paulie turns out his pockets -- he hands over some little baggies of weed. Zak points to the door.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Zak...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You want to wind up in the nick with my brother?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No? Then what do you wanna do for a livin’? Stand on a street corner like a prossie? Or wrestle?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Right. Then cut this crap or I ain’t trainin’ ya. Paulie nods apologetically. Zak softens.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paulie, you got talent, mate. If you focus and work hard, you could be as good as me.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Can I be as good as Saraya? The question is a gut punch for Zak. He covers.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: CALUM
dialogues.text: Can I be as good as her, Zak? The other strays begin to echo the sentiment: “Could I be good as Saraya?" “Can I be like her? -- a cacophony in Za head.  55 56 57 58.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (curt) Yes! His bluntness surprises everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softening) Yes... if you all work at it... so let’s go... come on... Calum resumes his practice.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rest of you, blow ups, let’s go... The Strays begin BLOW UP DRILLS with renewed vigour. PUSH IN on Zak, as his thoughts churn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya carries a basket from the laundry room. She passes t pool. Kirsten, Madison and Jeri-Lynn are sunbathing, music blar laughing and joking, flirting with a handful of the MALE WRESTLERS. As Raya passes at a distance, she observes the fun -- detached -- distant -- uninvited. She locks eyes with Kirsten -- who flashes her gleaming w teeth, then leans into Jeri-Lynn, whispers something to h Jeri-Lynn laughs, glances at Raya. Throws a smile her way Raya climbs the steps to her apartment. INT. RAYA’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT 56 Raya -- unable to sleep -- cuddles Ultimate Warrior -- st up at the ceiling fan. Rolls over. Looks at the PICTURES her bedside table of her family.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (PRE LAP)
dialogues.text: I miss you all so much. INT. RAYA’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 57 Raya is talking with Ricky and Julia on Skype. Ricky is eating a plate of HOTDOGS.  59.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I can’t sleep. I lie awake, wonderin’ what you’re all doing --

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: We miss you too, darlin’...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You eating healthy like I told you? (stuffing hotdog in his mouth) None of that Yank junk food. You don’t wanna lose your figure. Mustard falls onto his beer gut. Raya looks at her mum and dad, chooses her words carefull

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I don’t think I belong here.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What d’ya mean?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I belong with you over there. With the family.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You're over there for the family.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: But it’s so lonely here. I got no friends.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Get a cat.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Rick...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I’m not lettin’ you jack it in ‘cause you’re not gettin’ invited to bloody sleepovers.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I thought Zak would be here.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Well he ain’t! He fucked it up, Roy fucked it up, you’re not fuckin’ it up, too.  58 59 60 60.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Ricky -- Raya begins to tear up. Julia looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: No! Save your tears for the pillow, we ain’t speakin’ to you if you call us cryin’.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (peacemaker ) Ricky... Raya wipes away the tears. Ricky cools off.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Darlin’, when I was livin’ on the streets, I never dreamt I’d have kids, let alone one with the talent to be rich and bloody famous. You can have everythin’ I never had, darlin’. But not if you quit. Raya nods, taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Just... try and fit in more... Off Raya’s reluctant nod -- INT. RAYA’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - NIGHT 58 Raya dumps two DRUG-STORE BAGS down on the counter. Takes some BOTTLES -- places them on the counter. Stares at herself in the mirror -- pushes her hand throug her JET BLACK HAIR -- starts to remove her LIP PIERCING. EXT. FLORIDA - pay {| 59 AERIAL SHOT: An NXT-BRANDED COACH speeds down a two-lane highway. INT. NXT TOUR BUS - CONTINUOUS Oo 60 The Class -- guys and girls -- socialize. An NXT-BRANDED COACH rolls along. Jeri-Lynn is muttering Kirsten and a few others. She looks further down the coac follow her gaze to Raya, sitting alone at the back.  61 62 61. She has transformed herself. Fake tan, way too orange -- bottle blonde hair -- bright lipstick -- painted nails -- colorful clothes -- a DIY imitation of the other girls. Jeri-Lynn leans over.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: You look unbelievable. Who did your tan?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I did it myself.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: No way? What about your make-up?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: No way. It looks almost as professional as your tan.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Thanks. Raya smiles, pleased. Jeri-Lynn whispers something to Kirsten, who smiles, nods. Raya notices -- her smile fade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak being STRANGLED by a HULK in a rowdy CAGE MATCH. ANGLE ON: Union Jack, in the crowd, filming Zak in action The Hulk pours THUMBTACKS all over the mat. Slams Zak bac first onto the tacks. The crowd cheer. Union Jack zooms i

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, it’s Zak Zodiak calling again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak -- alone -- picks TACKS out of his back.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Zak, we reviewed your new tape, and we were all very impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Great. Thank you.  63 I/E. VAN - NIGHT Oo Rain pours. The van sits on the hard shoulder of a dual carriageway. Hazard lights on. INTERCUT with Hutch.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: But... I’m afraid the answer is still no.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Can I speak to someone else, please? Someone higher up?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I’m afraid not.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Mate, you don’t understand. This is my dream.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I do understand, but the decision's been made. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Please, I have a kid now. I made my girlfriend promises. She’s not gonna stay around if --

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I can’t help you any more.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: There’s gotta be something I can do. I can work harder, I can train.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: We're lookin’ for somethin’ you can’t train for.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Somethin’ extra.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I have that.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: But my sister does? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: The decision’s been made.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Stop sayin’ the decision’s been made. Change the fuckin’ decision! Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Please... The line goes dead. HOLD ON Zak, clutching his phone -- he punches the wheel repeatedly. Unleashes his anger -- desperation. Sits alone in the rain-swept van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch hangs up the phone -- walks back out to the MAIN VE A SMALL LOCAL CROWD fill bleachers around a ring. Hutch finds himself beside Raya, watching from the wings Madison and Jeri-Lynn sell a SO-SO ROUTINE to the crowd. Plodding moves receive cheers and cat-calls. They may not great wrestlers -- but they’re going over. Raya watches the red-blooded crowd eating them up. Anxiety rising, Raya steps away. Hutch notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya rushes in. Throws her head over the sink. Pukes. Runs water. Cleans her face. Looks at herself in the mirr  66 67 64. INT.
