ZAK AND COURTNEY'S FLAT - NIGHT Oo 66 Zak is slumped on the sofa, half-watching the TV, drinkin beer. Kayden is on his playmat. Zak's phone rings. He looks at the caller ID: RAYA. Stare her name. Considers answering. Presses ‘cancel’. KAYDEN starts to cry. Zak looks down at him -- turns up t volume on the TV. As Kayden bawls -- so Zak RAISES THE VOLUME -- until the is in full contest with the WHINE OF THE CHILD. Courtney enters, scoops up Kayden.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Zak. She comforts the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsten circles Raya in the ring, holding the mic.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: My name is Kirsten, I’m the future of the NXT... and the future looks good. CHEERS of approval. “Damn good!" “Yeahhhh!"

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so hot, I make the sun jealous. Rowdy DUDES in the crowd WHISTLE AND CAT-CALL lustily for Kirsten, who plays up to it -- born to this. Madison and Jeri-Lynn applaud admiringly from the back. Hutch looks on -- monitoring the reaction -- evaluating.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paige, little Paige... I could say I’m gonna rearrange your teeth -- but you’re British, I'd be doing you a favor! CHEERS of approval.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what would look good with that outfit? This body.  65. More CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So get ready -- because I'm about to slap you so hard when you stop rolling your clothes’1l be out of style. If those clothes ever were in style! More HOLLERS of approval. ANGLE ON: Hutch taking it in. The Douche and his cronies CHEER louder than anyone. Kirsten soaks in her applause, hands the mic to the refer who hands it on to Raya. Raya looks at Kirsten, never feeling less attractive -- o more inadequate. She looks out at the audience -- HAYSEED LOCALS swilling beer, waiting to be impressed -- none of the welcoming fa of her Norwich regulars. Heckles ring out from a FAT SLOBBY DOUCHE in the front ro sucking down a 24 OZ beer, surrounded by braying bros.

dialogues.speaker: DOUCHE
dialogues.text: What do you call this look? ‘Old gay man from Miami?’ THROATY LAUGHTER from his cronies, rattling Raya. A bead of sweat trickles down her face. Hutch inches forward. Senses something is not right.

dialogues.speaker: DOUCHE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What spray-tan did you ask for? ‘Donald Trump's ball-sack?’ LAUGHTER. Raya raises the mic to her mouth. All eyes on her. The spotlights blaze. Audience expectant. She catches sig of Hutch watching her. The world suddenly falls silent -- the only sound the thu of her heart. THUMP, THUMP, THUMP. Raya opens her mouth to speak -- and NOTHING COMES OUT.  68 69 66. Mute -- dry -- burning up under the scrutiny. Frozen. Failure.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP, THUMP, THUMP
dialogues.text: The Douche starts BOOING Raya. Others join in. Raya stews in her humiliation -- as the boo-ing rises. Hu lowers his head -- taking no pleasure. Jeri-Lynn, Madison and the rest of the NXT watch as she climbs from the ring and hurries backstage -- to a CACOPH OF JEERS. She passes Hutch, who watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls exit the stage door. A huddle of new fans surge around Kirsten, Madison and Jeri-Lynn -- ignore Raya, who pulls up her hood, heads for the coach. INT. coacH - niceT (J 69 Raya sits alone at the back, humiliated. She stares out a the night. She hears HUSHED VOICES -- Kirsten speaking in soft tones Madison and Jeri-Lynn. She hears snatches under the rumble of the coach: “She's happy... letting everyone down..." Raya hesitates -- takes a gulp -- steels herself -- then up -- powers towards Kirsten -- who immediately falls sil flashes a smile --

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: Hey. -- but Raya is looming down at her.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Which of your two faces wants the black eye?

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: What?  67.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: If you’ve got somethin’ to say about me, say it. Hutch and the others turn to watch.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: I don’t have anything to say about you.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Don’t! Don’t lie, or I will wipe that fake fuckin’ smile off your fake fuckin’ face.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: I’m not fake.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You're more fake -- (points to Jeri-Lynn) -- than her tits.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Fuck you. (to Kirsten) Talk about me behind my back again and I will fuck you up.

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: She wasn’t talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I heard her.

dialogues.speaker: JERI-LYNN
dialogues.text: She wasn't talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Then who was she talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: Her. Kirsten holds up a PICTURE on her PHONE of a pretty 5 YEA OLD GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Who's she?  70 68.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: My daughter. Who I haven’t seen in four months, because I’m here, putting up with your shit so she can have a better life. Raya steps back.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I didn't know you had a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: No, you don’t know anything about me -- (re: Madison/Jeri-Lynn) -- or them, or what our lives are, or why we’re here.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You... never told me.

dialogues.speaker: KIRSTEN
dialogues.text: You never asked. Raya takes this in. Notices Hutch and the rest of the Cla looking at her. She slowly moves to the back of the coach, slinks down in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Class buy snacks, stretch their legs, use the rest-ro Raya stands alone, staring out at the passing traffic. Hutch wanders up, sipping from a can of soda. Stares out the traffic for a beat. Raya’s eyes flick at Hutch -- as he takes another sip of drink.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Why do you want to be here?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: To... be on the main roster.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: To win the Diva’s title.  69.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: It’s my dream.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I’m tellin’ you why.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: No you're not. Raya falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was on the main roster for awhile. Did ya know that? Raya shakes her head ‘no’. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back in the 90s. On the road like this, two hundred days a year, barely saw my wife or kids. Body took a poundin’ every night -- hadda perform with dislocated elbows, broken jaws, torn rotator cuffs -- but I wanted to be famous like my heroes and I'd already sacrificed so much, what was a little more pain? In Arizona one time, Ken Shamrock dropped me on a concrete floor, cracked three ribs. All I wanted was to go home -- but I had a match the next night -- ten thousand tickets sold, story-lines we'd built up over months. The show must go on. I sat in a hotel room, five-hundred miles from everyone I cared about, and I couldn’t remember why I was there. Just didn’t know anymore. All I knew was I had two options: throw in the towel and go home -- or suck it up and get back in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: What did you do?  71 72
You ever heard of me? Hutch drains the last of his soda.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta deliver every single night, whatever they throw at you. People say this is a fake sport but every time you get in that ring, the stakes are real. (then) I saw talent in London, that’s the only reason I’m not cuttin’ you right now -- but take Christmas, decide if you should be here -- ‘cause if not, don’t waste my time or yours comin’ back. And he heads for the coach -- ultimatum. INT. COACH - MoRNING [CJ] Raya looks out at the Florida

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya rides in the W.A.W. van, sights of her hometown. Ricky is behind the wheel. He outside --

dialogues.speaker: THE KNIGHT FAMILY HOME
dialogues.text: The house is gaudily drenched decorations. leaving Raya absorbing his 71 sunrise, lost in her thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: 72 looks out at the familiar rounds a corner, pulls up in Christmas lights and Raya climbs out of the van, her ORANGEY FAKE TAN in sharp contrast to the GREY BRITISH WINTER. Julia is waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Bloody hell! (re: Raya’s orange tan) Willy Wonka called -- he needs you back at the factory.  73 71. Raya takes the jibes with good grace. Julia hugs her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s so good to see you, darlin’. Kaiser comes bounding up. Raya kneels to greet him. He li her face.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Careful he don’t eat you. He thinks you're a Wotsit. Ricky and Julia LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Family are pulling crackers. Raya is holding Kayden, ing over him. Hugh and Daphne work through a largely ined lunch. Zak is quiet and subdued. He pulls a cracker with Courtne PLASTIC RING pops out.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: It’s what you wanted for Christmas, Courts -- an engagement ring! Courtney looks at Zak, who avoids her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: It’s supposed to cost him three month’s salary -- so that looks about right.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I’m only jokin’... Daphne turns to Raya.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: How are you getting on at the WWF?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: That’s the World Wildlife Fund. You mean WWE.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Yes, how you getting on?  72.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: It’s really hard.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (oblivious) If it was easy any poor fucker could do it. Raya winces -- knows Zak is stung by this.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Dad... that’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Guess what tomorrow night is, luv? Raya shakes her head. She bobs Kayden playfully.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Christmas-sacre.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s always fun.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Total sell-out this year.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: We thought perhaps -- as a surprise for the fans -- we could bring you on? To fight your brother?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I'd rather not. I'm really jet- lagged.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You’1l win. Go back to the States undefeated. The fans’1ll love it.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I could do with a break. Julia looks at Ricky, who meets her gaze. Then --

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Look, Princess, the truth is -- we already announced you’1ll be there. Raya’s face drops. She lowers Kayden.  73.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I’m exhausted. I’ve had a really tough year.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: We've all had a tough year, Princess. (gesturing around) You're doing it for the family...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I can just do it with Jack.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Zak, she’s the star -- no one’s payin’ to see you. Zak takes another blow stoically. Raya looks at her broth as a hammering starts on the FRONT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Bevis! Or Mr. Clondike, whatever you call yourself... Ricky, Julia, Courtney, Zak and Raya (holding Kayden) immediately drop out of sight beneath the table -- leavin Hugh and Daphne sitting alone, utterly bemused. Ricky crawls commando-style to the wall socket --

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (muttering) It’s Christmas! Who is this bloke? The Terminator? -- he switches off the Christmas tree lights. Julia's head pops back up -- she whispers to Hugh and Dap

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Hide.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Hide! Now! Hugh and Daphne do as they’re told -- drop to the ground, hide beneath the table. The DEBT COLLECTOR peers in through the window.  74 75 76 77 74.

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR
dialogues.text: I know you’re in there. I can see feet behind the table.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Daph, pull your fuckin’ feet in, luv. Daphne does what she’s told -- and pulls her fuckin’ feet Raya looks down at her nephew in her arms. Looks up -- se Zak staring at them both. 1/e. waw van - vay [OJ 74 Zak driving. Up ahead he sees a group of STRAYS -- among Paulie -- waiting to be picked up. He slows the van some distance away. Considers. Turns the down a side street to avoid them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calum sits on his lonely swing, listening out for the van PERKS UP as he hears a vehicle -- but it’s merely a POST- passing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulie looks at his watch, checks up and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck this... He strides off. The other Strays watch him go -- begin to disperse too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a ‘SOLD OUT’ banner pasted across a poster that reads ‘CHRISTMASSACRE’ -- featuring PAIGE from WWE!! PULL WIDE to reveal -- a CAPACITY CROWD. The Strays have front row seats. Ricky and Julia -- dressed as wrestling versions of MR. A MRS. SANTA CLAUS -- prowl the ring, playing up to the cro  78 79 75.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: He’s been makin’ a list and checkin’ it twice...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna find out who's naughty and nice... and CRUSH ‘EM! The crowd BOO AND CHEER happily. The Strays are loving it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya makes her way to the STAGE-DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What did you do to your self? She looks round. Hannah and Ellie are approaching her.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s different in America. They want glamour, y’know. Not some freak.

dialogues.speaker: HANNAH
dialogues.text: You said you were proud to be a freak. Raya has no answer -- as the girls walk off, disappointed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya adjusts her costume, Zak ties his boots.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Kayden’s beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Thanks. Zak gets up. Takes his place by the curtain. Watches his parents warming up the crowd. Raya joins him at the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Can I tell you somethin’?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: ‘Course.  76.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I'm not going back. Zak turns -- shocked.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you help me tell mum and dad? Zak stares at her -- processing -- as we hear --

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please welcome -- your reigning champion --

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Zak?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- the unstoppable --

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Will you?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: -- the un-tame-able -- Zak Zodiak!! Zak gives no answer as his THEME TUNE PLAYS -- he throws the curtain and bounds out. Raya lets him go -- watches as the audience give hima generous response and he climbs into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: And for one night only -- in the flesh -- please welcome -- the next biggest star of the WWE --

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Of America!

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: -- your homecoming queen -- and the greatest talent the W.A.W. has ever produced -- CLOSE ON Zak, gritting his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY/JULIA
dialogues.text: Paige! Raya jogs out to her THEME TUNE. Less an entrance, more a victory lap. The crowd go insane -- on their feet -- snap pictures - clawing for autographs. The Strays CHEERING PROUDLY.  77. Ricky and Julia grin -- exchange a gleeful look of pride their new ‘superstar’. CLOSE ON Zak watching the overwhelming response for Raya. Ricky stays in the ring to referee as Julia climbs out, passing Raya as she slips through the ropes and into the ring. Mum winks at daughter, squeezes her arm. Raya nods, less excited. Ricky leans in to the siblings as if explaining the rules

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (hushed) You know the drill -- bit of back and forth, Zak gets the best of you -- last minute, you kick his arse. Raya nods. Zak does not move. Julia rings the bell. Raya and Zak lock up. Swing into battle. Raya sends Zak crashing to the mat. WILD CHEERS from the audience. Zak jumps back up. Raya grabs his arm, whips him towards turnbuckle -- but Zak reverses it -- flings her into the turnbuckle instead -- with venom. Zak approaches Raya -- loads her up for a BODY SLAM. Slams her down. Hard. Raya lies, winded by the drop. Ricky is startled by Zak’s aggression. BOOS from the crowd. The Strays surprised. Raya gets to her feet, staggers momentarily, unbalanced. and Zak lock up.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Go easy, would ya. Zak loads her up again, dead-eyed. SLAM! Raya lands harder than before. More BOOS for Zak. R leans in.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (whispered, to Zak) Careful -- you’re gonna hurt her.  78. Raya is dazed from the drop. Rolls away, staggers to her feet. Stretches her neck -- not for show. Ricky looks at Julia -- both concerned. Zak approaches Raya, menace in his eyes. Raya gives hima BOOT to the mid section. For real! He doubles over. CHEERS for Raya. She takes Zak down -- g for the pin. The crowd chant along with Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One...! Two...! Zak kicks out. More BOOS. The siblings rise to their feet. Lock up again. Zak grabs Raya around the back of her head, one hand on h hip. He loads her up --

dialogues.speaker: SLAM
dialogues.text: Ricky and Julia both recoil at the fury.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Zak's face) What are you doin’? Raya’s prostrate on her back. Shaking off the fall. Zak d on top of her in a pin. She struggles but there’s NO ESCA Ricky slides in close.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zak! She's s’posed to win... Zak ignores him. The crowd chant “ONE!” Ricky whispers to Zak.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let her win... The crowd chant ‘TWO!’  80

dialogues.speaker: RAYA

Ricky stares at Zak, who stares back defiantly -- then ra his fist in the air. Relentless BOOS from the crowd -- not the outcome they pa for. Raya stares at her brother -- but he does not meet her ga

dialogues.speaker: RAYA

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zak? Ricky and Julia burst outside. Ricky barrels Shoves him hard against the wall.

dialogues.text: She does what she’s told.

dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY

dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.text: What then? Julia and Ricky stare at Raya -- but it’s Zak who speaks.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: She’s quittin’...

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Zak!

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You wanted my help tellin’ em -- you're welcome. Zak walks off. Ricky turns on Raya.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You're goin’ back if I have to drag you to the States myself.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You’re an alchy ex-con -- they won't let you in.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Watch your fuckin’ mouth!

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: (intervening) Rick!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You're going back! Julia steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: We know it's tough, darlin’, but this is what you always wanted.  81 81.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Is it? Or is it what you always wanted?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Raya points to a poster on the wall -- the W.A.W. ONE-SHE featuring Julia in teeth-baring tigeress mode and in bold lettering: “SWEET SARAYA”.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: You named me after your own ring name! I’m not doin’ this just ‘cause you're too old and fucked to do it yourself. Julia's eyes FLASH -- WHAP! She SLAPS her daughter clean across the face. FWAP! Raya slaps her straight back.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Stoppit! Jesus! Ricky breaks them apart.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Raya) You're doin’ what we say. We know what’s best for ya, you’re still just a kid.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I know. So instead of bein’ my coach or my promoter -- how about bein’ my fuckin’ parents? And is gone. Ricky fumes. Looks at Julia for support -- but she is sti reeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - An 8x10 PUBLICITY PHOTO of Raya -- scowling, Goth look, combat boots. Hands tear it into shreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 83 84 82. INT. RAYA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 82 Raya dumps the shreds of photo into a TRASH BAG. She picks up a wrestling trophy. Tosses it into the bag. Picks up a handful of WWE ACTION FIGURES -- tosses them - -- picks up the PHOTO of herself after her first match -- grinning, arm in arm with Zak, dressed in his PINK POWER RANGER OUTFIT. She throws it in the TRASH -- as there’s a KNOCK ON THE D

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: It’s me...

dialogues.speaker: RAYA

dialogues.text: Courtney called. Your brother's missing... Raya looks up -- opens the door -- locks eyes with her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Zak, swigging from a bottle of vodka, lost in hi darkness. His mobile phone is ringing. He takes it out of his pocke looks at the caller ID: Raya. Cancels the call. They scan the streets. No sign of Zak. Raya looks out -- up on the hillside -- she sees the loom outline of the PRISON.  85 86 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The W.A.W. van prowls through the night. Searching. INT. W.A.W. VAN - CONTINUOUS Oo 86 Julia looks over at Ricky, then -- fear and worry etched her face -- turns to Raya.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: If you don’t want to go back to America... we’re not gonna make you.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What? (to Raya) You're goin’ back.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Not if she don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Has everyone gone mad?! If she gets on the main roster, she’s set for life.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: She is -- or you are?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: All of us. You want me to go back to robbin’ banks to feed this family?

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: What family? Our daughter’s miserable. One son’s in jail, the other’s hangin’ on by a thread --

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Zak is fine.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Will you pull your thick head out yer fat arse! Zak is not fine! And if you’ve gotta go back to robbin’ banks to feed this family, so be it, ‘cause at this rate, we’re not gonna have a fuckin’ family to feed!  87 84.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Stop! Ricky turns. Raya is pointing through the windscreen -- a Zak's car parked haphazardly in the street.

dialogues.speaker: A SPIT-AND-SAWDUST BOOZER.
dialogues.text: Zak is at the bar working rapidly through a beer and a whiskey chaser. He finishes both, summons refills from th barman. A THUGGISH-LOOKING BRUISER stands next to Zak at the bar. is served FOUR PINTS OF BEER. Zak watches as he gathers them up and turns towards his o THUGGISH-LOOKING FRIENDS. Zak deliberately gets up and elbows the Bruiser -- sendin the beers crashing to the floor. The Bruiser spins on Zak -- towers above him.

dialogues.speaker: BRUISER
dialogues.text: You just stuck you're fuckin’ elbow out.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: BRUISER
dialogues.text: You callin’ me a liar?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No. I'm callin’ you a wanker. Beat. The Bruiser gets in Zak's face.

dialogues.speaker: BRUISER
dialogues.text: I didn't hear that...

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Didn't ya? Then you're a deaf prick, as well. The Bruiser swings a punch. Zak is ready for it -- side-s -- clobbers him. The other Bruisers immediately come at Zak -- he fights t off -- they trade punches -- crash through a table, knock drinks flying.  88 85. The Bruisers back Zak towards a POOL TABLE. Zak grabs a POOL CUE, swings at a Bruiser who tries to si swipe him. The cue breaks over his shoulder. Zak raises the severed cue, is about to bring it down on another Bruiser when a hand grabs his arm. He spins around, ready to smack someone -- -- finds himself staring at Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Ricky manhandles Zak towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky bundles Zak out of the pub. Zak spins into the stre stumbles -- sees Julia, looking pained -- pauses for a mo -- then regains his footing -- drunkenly lashes out at hi father -- but it’s Ricky’s turn to side-step. He grabs his son’s arm -- twists it -- Zak swivels out of hold -- suddenly sees his sister looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Zak... Zak ignores her. Goes at his father like a ram. Tries to down Ricky -- Ricky defends himself, trying not to hurt Z Nothing choreographed about this rumble. Ricky may be older and slower but he’s sober, with twice experience. He finally spins Zak into a HYBRID NELSON HOLD -- Zak thrashes like a MADMAN in a STRAITJACKET. Julia holds her hand to her mouth in angst. Raya stands in front of Zak. Eye to eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming) Zak... Zak shakes his head -- huffs like a grizzly.
Zak... Zak wants to fight, to rage -- but she stares at him -- h face calm -- caring -- full of love. Zak cools a little.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad. Let him go... Ricky loosens his hold. Zak looks at his sister. Gathers his breath. Walks Julia reaches out for him. Raya raises her hand -- goes after him. TRACK with Zak, as Raya calls out.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zak. Talk to me. Zak strides on.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why won't you talk to me? off. “let me” Zak stops -- turns, advances on her -- fury in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I can’t even look at you! Raya backs away, intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Why? Why?! D’ya know what it’s like to want one fuckin’ thing in life, one dream, you work for, train for, get this close to -- and you’re own fuckin’ sister takes it from you? And then decides she doesn’t even want it after all?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn’t take your dream, Zak.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: No? Then why am I stuck here?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Because they didn’t want you! This stuns Zak. Raya softens, not wanting to fight. RAYA (CONT’D) I'm sorry, it’s shitty, but it’s not my fault, it’s just how it is.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Just how it is?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Yes. So you can either curl up ina ball and die, or start seein’ all the things you’ve got here.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: What’ve I got here?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: A beautiful son. A girlfriend who loves you --

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: -- ‘cause she thought I'd be famous.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: No, you dozy twat, ‘cause you’re kind and lovin’... believe in people, inspire ‘em --

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Who do I inspire?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Me. Those kids at the gym. You're teachin’ a blind kid to wrestle, how is that even possible? Just ‘cause a million people don’t cheer when you do it doesn’t mean it’s not important. A flicker in Zak’s eyes. She’s getting through to him -- 87.  89 88.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) I didn’t steal your dream, Zak. You shared it with me. It’s my dream too. Zak's face hardens again.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Then why the fuck are you throwin’ it away? Raya takes this in -- as Zak on his heel -- and is gone. INT. RAYA’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 89 Raya lies on her bed, chewing over Zak’s words. Her door is ajar. Kaiser bounds in, jumps on her bed. She looks up -- Ricky and Julia stand in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Your mum's right, Princess. If you don’t wanna go back, don’t. You shouldn't ever do nothin’ ‘cause me or anyone else told you to. He and Julia enter, sit down either side of Raya.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're the spark in our lives -- whatever you do with yours. Raya quivers with emotion. Julia and Ricky put their arms around her, kiss and embrace her. They hold each other for a tender moment, then break away Ricky kisses Raya on the top of her head. They both leave Kaiser stays. Raya watches as he prowls around the room. sniffs at the GARBAGE BAG on the floor. Chews at a crumpl sheet of paper poking from it. Raya gets up, pulls the sheet of paper out -- unfolds it. It's ELLIE'S SKETCH of Raya, holding aloft the WWE Championship Belt. Raya looks at the illustration -- grinning -- victorious immortal.  90 91 89. Raya hugs Kaiser as she looks at her REAL SELF, reflected her bedroom mirror.

A figure enters -- at first obscured by equipment and mov bodies -- but eventually we see -- RAYA IS BACK -- along her BLACK HAIR -- pale GOTH MAKE-UP -- PIERCINGS and ROCK CHICK clothes. She passes Hutch, who registers the change. Passes Jeri-Lynn and Madison -- climbs onto the treadmill next to Kirsten, begins jogging. Kirsten glances at her. Raya speeds up her treadmill until she is running. Kirsten does the same, keeping pace --

With great effort, Raya passes Kirsten -- reaches the tir flip. Hutch watches as the girls begin to flip their tires. Onc Twice. It’s a race to the finish. Neck and neck. Raya notices Madison to her left, struggling once again - ignores her -- flips her tire for a third time -- -- moves ahead of Kirsten and Jeri-Lynn. She drops her ti Dashes for the finish -- -- when she stops -- A quizzical look crosses Hutch’s face -- -- as Raya doubles back. Runs over to Madison -- still struggling with her tire -- and begins to scream in her f  92 93 94 95 90.

dialogues.text: C'mon...!

dialogues.text: I can’t!

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Yes you can! Suddenly -- Kirsten and Jeri-Lynn are beside Raya, cheeri on Madison too -- as Hutch looks on. Finally, Madison flips her tire. And another. And a third time -- buoyed by the other women. All four girls race for the finish line -- cross at the s time -- collapse -- delighted and exhausted. Raya locks eyes with Hutch, as we --

dialogues.text: Raya, Kirsten, Madison and Jeri-Lynn work through a routi which segues into --

dialogues.text: The Class stand in formation.  96 97 91. Hutch walks between them, eye-balling each contender. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: For you and the NXT, this is the end of the line... He offers up his hand -- to Black Adonis. EXT. FLORIDA - DAY oO 96 AERIAL SHOT: The NXT coach makes it’s way down the highwa

dialogues.text: Raya vs. Jeri-Lynn. CAT-CALLS for Jeri-Lynn as she parade before Raya, mic in hand, trash talking.

dialogues.text: Look at her -- jumpy as a long tailed cat in a room full of rockin' chairs. The crowd LAUGH AND CHEER. JERI-LYNN (CONT’D) I'm fixin’ to whup ya like a rented mule. When I'm done, you'll be uglier than a bucket full o’ armpits.

dialogues.text: What d’ya mean: will be? It’s the DOUCHE from before, JEERING from the front row. Jeri-Lynn hands the mic to Raya. We see the crowd from Raya’s POV, another rowdy mob in a Florida backwater, hard to please. As ever -- Hutch at the back -- watching -- judging. The lights burn down. Blinding.

dialogues.speaker: DOUCHE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen my boner? It was here a minute ago. SNICKERS from his gang and like-minded idiots. Raya goes quiet. The crowd MURMUR, expectant.  92.

dialogues.speaker: DOUCHE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the only groupie Marilyn Manson won't fuck! More LAUGHTER. Raya crosses to the ropes, stares down at the Douche.

dialogues.text: You're not what I paid for.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: I know -- the girl you paid for is tied up in your basement. SURPRISED LAUGHTER from the crowd. Wooo. Where’d that com from?

dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: My name is Paige.

dialogues.text: What are you doin’ here?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: The same job as my mother. You should do the same job as your mother and hang around the docks, waitin' for the sailors to come in. More “WOOS”, some scattered applause. Crowd warming to he

dialogues.text: Eat my dick.

dialogues.text: You suck.

dialogues.text: Yeah, but you swallow. On fire now.  98 99 93.

dialogues.text: I've been doin’ this since I was thirteen. You could show us what you were doin’ at thirteen, but no one wants to see you spyin’ on your grandmother takin’ a shower... Crowd loving this girl now. Even the Douche’s friends LAU

dialogues.text: So sit there and if you speak again, I'll stick my foot so far up your arse, you'll be using my big toe as a tongue. The room BLOWS UP. VOCAL. Approving. Stamping feet. The Douche falls silent -- vanquished -- as Hutch looks o

dialogues.text: Paige... can... we have a picture? Raya nods, surprised, puts her arms round them, as they b to take pictures. They hug Raya tight -- she returns the affection. From the door of the bus -- Hutch notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Class still in formation. Raya watches as Hutch’s han moves toward her -- -- extends past Raya -- to LONG HAIRED DUDE. Who starts t cry. The other dudes console him.

dialogues.text: Those of you still here, give yourself a round of applause --  100 101 102 94.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: As a reward, April 6th I’m takin’ you all on a date to a romantic little place I call... Wrestlemania! As the Class explode into cheers and Raya grins excitedly

dialogues.text: The heavy PRISON GATE gate opens -- and Roy walks out. He welcomed with hugs and tears by Ricky and Julia. They hand a gift bag to Roy -- who reaches inside, lifts - a ZEBRA PRINT LEOTARD. He grins. Then looks around --

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Where’s Zak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak walks up the street, smoking, drinking a beer. He stops. Up ahead -- he sees Paulie, back on ‘his’ wall. A man in MID-20s approaches -- they exchange a few words. Paulie reaches behind the wall, pulls something up. They street handshake. Mid-20s goes on his way. Zak moves forward -- for a moment we think he’s crossing road to reprimand Paulie -- but then he veers down a side street -- leaving Paulie to count his cash.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE LANE
dialogues.text: Zak walks head-down -- when he bumps hard into a MAN comi the other way with his MATE.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Watch it. Zak looks around. It’s the Street Toughs who were earlier hassling Paulie. Zak watches them go -- as they head towards Paulie’s corn  103 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two STREET TOUGHS are working Paulie over. It’s all Paulie can do to cover-up and deflect the blows.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt, mate... The Tough turns -- it’s Zak.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: +. but he's due at wrestling trainin’.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I would, but he's paid for the lesson, so he could sue. Zak steps forward, the Tough pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH
dialogues.text: Seriously, stick to the fake fightin', yeah? He turns back, raises his fist to give Paulie a wallop -- when Zak grabs his arm. The tough instinctively swings a RIGHT HOOK at Zak -- who deftly ducks underneath it, steps forward -- uses his rig arm to collar the punk -- and SLAMS him down with a ROCK BOTTOM. The punk gasps for air, wind knocked out of him.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Did that feel fake, mate? STREET TOUGH 2 steps towards Zak -- who stares him down. Tough gives Zak a once over -- doesn’t fancy his chances grabs his friend and drags him away. Zak turns to Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Good --  104 105 106 107 96. Zak gives him a clip round the ear.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Arrghhh. What’s that for?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: For missin’ training. Off Paulie’s confused look -- EXT. PARK -— DAY 104 Calum sits sullenly on his swing. Behind him, Zak, Paulie the W.A.W. van pull up. Zak HONKS the horn. Calum looks up, confused. HONK. Calum’s frown turns to a grin -- as we -- EXT. NORWICH STREET - DAY Oo) 105 The Strays are taking turns tossing half a concrete block a street light in an effort to smash it. One or two of th younger ones have lashed a handful of fireworks together are trying to light them. Suddenly -- Metallica. They all look up, see Zak and the van approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Julia are doing their tax returns. They hear something outside. They get up to investigate -- find Zak running the Strays through drills. He is holding Kayden, Courtney looks on. Ricky and Julia exchange glances. Ricky wanders up beside Zak. They share a look. Ricky rea up, brings his son’s head to his, pats it proudly. Zak reciprocates. The most these two men can ‘say’ to one another.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: WRESTLEMANIA XXX TELECAST. THE ROCK is in the ring, worki the crowd, who are going BERSERK.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (PRE LAP)
dialogues.text: The Rock has come back to Wrestlemania!  108 109 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya and the NXT Class wander, wide-eyed, taking in the backstage hubbub -- WWE superstars getting MADE-UP -- adjusting costumes -- running through routines. They stop at a lavish CATERING SPREAD, stock up on food. takes a handful of HOTDOGS. A hand taps Raya on the shoulder. She throws the hotdogs like she’s been caught. The hand belongs to Hutch. She turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Come with me. Raya looks disconcerted, follows Hutch. Kirsten and the o girls watch her go.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: (to Hutch) Is everything okay? He doesn’t reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya stands beside Hutch. The elevator doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya follows Hutch down a corridor. They stop outside a DRESSING ROOM. A BURLY SECURITY GUY o the door. Hutch looks at Raya, gestures inside. She hesitatingly enters, confused -- watches Hutch as he walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raya takes in the plush surroundings: leather sofas, lamp candles, treadmill, buffet of food and beverage. She stands for a moment, uncertain of what is happening, suddenly the door opens -- and Dwayne Johnson strides in.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Hey. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Fine... You?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: Never better. You want anything? Sugar-free soda? Sugar-free gum? Wheat-free donuts? Raya shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Water? Vitamin water? Protein water?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: No, thanks. I got three hot dogs waitin’ for me.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I haven't eaten a hot dog since 1987.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Do you want one? They’ve got loads out there.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I mean out of choice.

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Dwayne walks into an adjoining bathroom, begins his ‘stage’ to ‘civilian’ shirt. Raya’s not sure what she’s doing there.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: How’s your family?

dialogues.speaker: RAYA
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: When’s the last time you spoke to them?

dialogues.text: It’s Raya and the bloody Rock. The Strays and Pro’s react excitedly. Zak betrays no emot Ricky puts the phone on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I heard some news tonight, so I asked Coach if I could tell you all myself.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: RICKY JULIA
dialogues.text: Eh?

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On tomorrow night's RAW she’s going to fight the Diva’s champion for the title.

dialogues.speaker: JULIA
dialogues.text: Fuck me dead, bury me pregnant. Dwayne reacts to this phrase for the second time. Zak remains impassive -- unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Dwayne. You don’t know what this means to us.

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: I think I do, sir, I come from a wrestling family myself, started off ripping tickets for my dad in Buttfuck, Texas. I’m sure Paige is like me; first time I went out on the main roster, what helped me rise to the occasion was thinking: I'm doing do this for my family. Zak listens, stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: RICKY

dialogues.speaker: ROY

CAPTIONS: Oo 157 Calum and Paulie are now professional wrestlers. Julia started her own women's wrestling promotion. Ricky retired from live wrestling... but was so miserable Julia made him start again. Zak continues to wrestle in a tag-team with Roy... and tr new recruits at the W.A.W. School. Paige is two-time Diva’s Champion... and one of WWE's biggest... and most controversial... stars. Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson went on to a successful career outside of wrestling. FADE OUT.
